title: These boots were made for … autumn: the best women’s footwear for the season
description: Whether you’re ambling along in the countryside, running around the city or heading to the office, solid footwear is a must at this time of year. Here’s our pick of the best boots to buy nowFew things make venturing out in the autumn chill and mizzle less appealing than when you are lacking the right footwear. But finding a stylish pair of boots, that can handle whatever the weather may throw at you while working for different occasions, isn’t always easy.So, we’ve done the hard work for you and narrowed down the options. From comfy boots for stomping around the countryside to chic versions for the office and party options for the festive season, here are the best boots to shop now. Continue reading...
author: Chloe Mac Donnell and Melanie Wilkinson

title: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH reports surprise sales drop amid China slowdown
description: Shares in LVMH, which also owns Dior, Tiffany and Moët & Chandon, fell by as much as 7%, briefly hitting two-year lowShares in luxury goods brands slumped after Louis Vuitton’s LVMH reported an unexpected fall in third-quarter sales amid China’s economic slowdown.Shares in LVMH, which also owns Dior, Tiffany and Moët & Chandon, fell by as much as 7% in early trading, briefly hitting a two-year low, before regaining slightly, after it warned of an “uncertain economic and geopolitical environment”,with falling sales in Asia. Continue reading...
author: Joanna Partridge

title: Should I Press My Adult Son to Break Up With His Girlfriend?
description: A reader worries that her 29-year-old son is stringing along his girlfriend of nearly three years: She wants marriage and children, but he’s not sure she’s “the one.”

title: The 14 Best Nordstrom Bags For Every Fall Occasion
description: We can always count on Nordstrom as a go-to for our favorite shoes, sweaters, denim, and handbags. Aside from looking great, a quality bag should be able to hold all of your essentials while being easy to wear and versatile enough to be teamed with numerous outfits. We've uncovered a variety of options that incorporate the season's biggest trends while also considering longevity and practicality. Whether you need a small but elegant bag to carry to a fall wedding, a tote bag for your work commute, a crossbody or belt bag for travel, or a water-resistant bag for beach and pool days, we have options for everything. With a wide range of budgets in mind, there are affordable picks starting at just $50, as well as designer bags you'll wear for years. We've cherry-picked a mix of customer favorites, as well as an editor-reviewed bag for you to peruse. Despite what your personal aesthetic is or the type of bag you're looking for, you're bound to find just the right one to pair with everything from jeans to dresses. Keep reading to shop our favorite Nordstrom bags this season. Related: Nordstrom's Best Sweaters, From Cropped Cardigans to Mock Necks
author: Angela Elias

title: Nordstrom's Must Have Fall Shoes, From Booties to Mules
description: Between the drop in temperature and the occasional rainy commute, fall is a convenient excuse to add some fresh shoes to the rotation, and Nordstrom is one of our favorite retailers to start our search. With its vast selection ranging from Nordstrom brands to designer options, it's easy to find a pair that fits your style at a price you're comfortable spending. After poring over the retailer's inventory, we're eyeing all of the shoes we can't wait to slip into for everything from attending fall weddings to pumpkin patch outings. We've honed in on a variety of styles, including sneakers, boots, comfortable heels, and everything in between. If you're ready to give your shoe selection a fall refresh, browse our curated list of Nordstrom's most covetable shoe styles.
author: Angela Elias

title: These 24 Cardis Definitely Aren’t Your Grandma’s
description: As we trade in our tank tops for warmer layers to keep us cozy on chilly days, we’re always keeping an eye out for the best sweaters on the market, whether they're chunky knits or turtlenecks. One style in particular has become an obsession lately: the cardigan.  The button-front jumper has been a longtime staple in fall and winter wardrobes, but it started making headlines a few years ago, when micro versions dominated New York Fashion Week, courtesy of designers like Maryam Nassir Zadeh and Kim Shui. As you can imagine, fashion enthusiasts and celebs ate it up — and they're still excited by them. Cardigans went from kind-of-frumpy-but-beloved to trending, worn by everyone from EmRata to Jennifer Lawrence. And brands are still finding ways to make it feel fresh: At the Fall/Winter 2024 shows, Ulla Johnson and Tibi styled them as capes.From whimsical hues and funky patterns to chunky knits and more classic silhouettes, cardigans are here to complement all your fall ‘fits. Here are 24 of the best front-close sweaters around to get you started.All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.For more can't-miss shopping stories delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our Most Wanted newsletter.SPRING INTROLIt’s no secret that we love sweaters during winter — chunky knits, turtlenecks, striped jumpers — you name it. But spring offers another glorious opportunity for knitwear as we trade in our heavier knits for lighter options that add that perfect finishing touch to a layered outfit (not to mention keep us warm on breezier spring days and are perfect for travel). The current style us R29ers have been turning to is: the cardigan.  Cardigans made a stylish comeback in 2022 when micro versions made headlines during New York Fashion Week. Designers like Maryam Nassir Zadeh and Kim Shui debuted tiny cardigans — the cousin to the viral pin tops — during their spring 2022 runways. As you can imagine, fashion enthusiasts and celebs ate it up — and they still are. Currently, these knitted bitties are hitting the streets in all colors and styles as a year round staple, you can see everyone from EmRata to Jennifer Lawrence wearing their cardigans around town. And this spring wardrobe staple will easily take you into next season — at the fall/winter 2024 shows, Ulla Johnson and Tibi used cardigans as capes.From whimsical hues, funky patterns, and chunky knits to classic silhouettes, front-close knits are here to complement your spring fits. Don't worry; we still added a few of the beloved oversized and cable-knit styles for you to throw on. Here are 25 of the best cardigans around to get you started.FALL INTRO:Maeve Belted Cable Cardigan SweaterTry out this untraditional yet chic belted cardigan.Shop Maeve at AnthropologieMaeve Belted Cable Cardigan Sweater, $, available at AnthropologieFree People Willow CardiFeel oh-so-soft in this fuzzy cardi.Shop Free PeopleFree People Willow Cardi, $, available at Free PeopleLululemon Alpaca Wool-Blend Cardigan SweaterThis cardigan doubles as a cover-up after a long workout — perfect if you need to run some errands afterward. Shop LululemonLululemon Alpaca Wool-Blend Cardigan Sweater, $, available at LululemonRachel Antonoff Cupcake CardiganLook as cute as... well, a cupcake in this colorful cardigan with the most adorable scalloped edges.Shop Rachel AntonoffRachel Antonoff Cupcake Cardigan, $, available at Rachel AntonoffZara Knit Cardigan With TiesWe love a tie-front moment. The fun contrasting trim on this elegant cardigan will elevate an everyday outfit.Shop ZaraZara Knit Cardigan With Ties, $, available at ZaraLisa Says Gah Lauda CardiIf there's one thing we can depend on Lisa Says Gah for, it's cute overload. This cardigan is no exception.Shop Lisa Says GahLisa Says Gah Lauda Cardi, $, available at Lisa Says GahHollister Comfy Cloud Cable-Knit CardiganLook absolutely darling in this under-$50 baby blue cable-knit cardi.Shop HollisterHollister Comfy Cloud Cable-Knit Cardigan, $, available at HollisterSézane Angie CardiganA cardigan with dreamy lace details — we'll take two.Shop SézaneSézane Angie Cardigan, $, available at SézanePistola Dani CardiganLook red-hot in this cherry-red cardi.Shop Pistola at RevolvePistola Dani Cardigan, $, available at RevolveHyacinth House Woven Maybourne CardiganThis gorgeously woven cardigan will take you from day to night, no matter the bottom you choose. We'd pair it with a colorful bubble or maxi skirt.Shop Hyacinth House at TuckernuckHyacinth House Cream Woven Maybourne Cardigan, $, available at TuckernuckAritzia Basque CardiganA less traditional cardigan, this merino wool and cotton-blend garment is great for warmer days.Shop AritziaWilfred Basque Cardigan, $, available at AritziaUniversal Standard Better-Than-Wool CardiganBrighten up the room with this cheery pink cardigan.Shop Universal StandardUniversal Standard Better-Than-Wool Cardigan, $, available at Universal StandardJ. Crew Featherweight Cashmere Shrunken CardiganWe have one thing to say about this cardigan... purr.Shop J. CrewJ. Crew Featherweight Cashmere Shrunken Cardigan, $, available at J. CrewLove, Bonito Amiera Relaxed Knit CardiganThis minimal cardigan by Love Bonito is just what your jeans-and-tee ordered.Shop Love, BonitoLove Bonito Amiera Relaxed Knit Cardigan, $, available at Love BonitoAlex Mill Nico CardiganBigger is better — just look at this chunky knit that’ll keep you cozy all season long.Shop Alex MillAlex Mill Nico Cardigan, $, available at Alex MillEverlane The Boxy CardiganBrown is in this season — why not incorporate it into your wardrobe via a cardigan?Shop EverlaneEverlane The Boxy Cardigan, $, available at EverlaneLa Ligne Striped Brushed Cashmere CardiganIn the case of classic striped knits, no one’s doing it like La Ligne. The brand's famous stripes have been seen on the likes of Anne Hathaway and Heather Graham, to name a few.Shop La Ligne at Neiman MarcusLa Ligne Striped Brushed Cashmere Cardigan, $, available at Neiman MarcusTopshop Cable Stitch Crop CardiganA classic cable knit cardigan never hurt anybody.Shop TopshopTopshop Cable Stitch Crop Cardigan, $, available at NordstromDraper James Varsity CardiganPerhaps the best part about this classy cardigan is that your furry best friend can match you — all for under $100!Shop Draper JamesDraper James Varsity Cardigan, $, available at Draper JamesQuince Baby Alpaca-Wool Cropped Cardigan Quince is back at it again with the affordable alpaca knitwear.Shop QuinceQuince Baby Alpaca-Wool Cropped Cardigan, $, available at QuinceLPA Ruffle Sweater CardiganLean into the coquette craze with this feminine ruffled cardigan.Shop LPA RevolveLPA Ruffle Sweater Cardigan, $, available at RevolveJenni Kayne Cable Cocoon CardiganJenni Kayne's classic Cable Cocoon cardigan is definitely one for the books.Shop Jenni KayneJenni Kayne Cable Cocoon Cardigan, $, available at Jenni KayneLake Pajamas Nora Cotton CardiganThe ribbed and oversized cuffs are a perfect addition to this cozy spring layering piece, and it’s  made of 100% cotton so you know it’s soft as heck.Shop Lake PajamasLAKE Pajamas Nora Cotton Cardigan, $, available at LAKE PajamasAlice + Olivia Kitty Puff-Sleeve CardiganAlice + Olivia always wows us with its eye-catching take on classics, such as this cable-knit cardigan with fabulous bow closures.Shop Alice + OliviaAlice + Olivia Kitty Puff-Sleeve Cardigan, $, available at Saks Fifth AvenueMadewell Split-Crewneck Cardigan Tank OLDClassic cardigan styles may not be for you, and that's okay. We love COS' cropped version for those who want the warmth of a cardi without the length.Shop COSCOS Cropped Wool-Blend Cardigan, $, available at COSUniversal Standard Fuzzy Duster CardiganOLDA nice long duster cardigan is the perfect apparel for a good ol' WFH day.Shop Universal StandardUniversal Standard Fuzzy Duster Cardigan, $, available at Universal StandardLove, Bonito Hazel Puff Sleeve Crop CardiganOLDWhen the weather warms up, this short-sleeved cropped cardigan allows you to maintain a polished cardi look. author: Eliza Huber

title: How Aligne Made Its Timeless Pieces Go Massively Viral
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. People tend to come across British label Aligne on their social feeds. Its signature blazers have gone viral on TikTok time and time again, leading many to the small-batch brand and converting them into customers. Earlier this year, Aligne unveiled its first-ever campaign on billboards across the UK, starring English soccer player Lucy Bronze in office-ready separates and crisp denim matching sets in place of her more familiar jersey and shorts.  The buzzy spring/summer 2024 ad spot was only the first indication that Aligne was in for a superstar year. Last month, it entered the Asia, Middle East and South America markets. It was also picked up by Shopbop, where it sold out within its first week. Most recently it relaunched its website with a fresh new logo that emphasizes its snappy name.  Of course, this level of superstardom doesn’t happen overnight. Aligne is actually four years old, but over the past 18 months it has undergone a major restructuring, shifting from its original wholesale business model (at stockists like Anthropologie and Liberty) to a direct-to-consumer brand. “When you prioritize wholesale, you lose valuable customer insights and the chance for meaningful interactions with the end consumer,” CEO Ginny Seymour, who joined the 15-woman team in 2022 as managing director, tells Refinery29. “I wanted to change that by fostering direct relationships between our brand and the people we serve.”  View this post on Instagram A post shared by Lucy Bronze MBE (@lucybronze) Prior to Aligne, Seymour was the director of product and sustainability at UK-based jewellery brand Astrid & Miyu, and was previously a buyer at Saks Fifth Avenue. The changes she’s introduced at Aligne have helped the brand feed demand for considered products just above the high street price point, to the tune of 600% year-over-year revenue growth by mid-2023, according to Glossy. Seymour says she really started noticing a shift in Aligne’s public profile last fall, going into the holiday season.  “We did this diamanté denim set that kind of broke Instagram in the UK,” she says. “At Christmas time, there wasn’t a week I opened my Instagram and didn’t see someone else wearing it. It felt like we’d done something, and it was the beginning of this next chapter.” Aligne’s other viral hits include the collarless blazer beloved by TikTok, and its Gabriella dress: a long-sleeve, collared midi that comes in several colors and has sold over 25,000 units. Denim is also a major category, accounting for more than half of the label’s sales. (“Denim’s really our DNA,” Seymour says. “We make it 100% in Istanbul, using organic cotton and a Jeanologia technology that uses 80% less water.”)  View this post on Instagram A post shared by ALIGNE (@aligne) Despite its proven digital prowess, Aligne is the kind of brand that grows through word of mouth: Where did you get that dress? It’s from Aligne! Born in east London, it specializes in classic, design-led pieces that focus on timelessness rather than trends.  “To me, Aligne is about creating a product that speaks to confident women who are going places,” Seymour says. “Whether you’re going to lunch, the boardroom or a sports activity, wearing Aligne means celebrating a community of strong females that dress for themselves.”  With sizes ranging from UK 4 to UK 22 and a price point that stays around $94 to $495 for most pieces, the brand has garnered a wide-ranging appeal. Aligne works primarily with natural fibers but, as Seymour says, “We don’t want to be known as a sustainable brand.”  @ellie.delphine Replying to @neah I’m obsessed with it !! #aligne #waistcoat #waistcoatoutfit #outfitinspiration ♬ original sound – Ellie Delphine “I think that was probably overused when the brand first came out,” she continues. “At the end of the day, we’re a fashion brand making products. But there’s no item in our collection that has less than 50% sustainable materials.” What’s most crucial to Aligne’s growth is its community, Seymour argues. “To be able to have these other confident females be part of our storytelling — it just feels so aligned with our ethos.”  That’s what inspired the Bronze campaign back in spring: “I think about when David Beckham was really big and every fashion brand was trying to get him. The correlation between men’s fashion and sport has always existed, and this change was finally happening in female sport. I wanted to enter the conversation as a small brand, because female athletes stand for every single adjective I would want to be described as myself. I just adore her and that campaign and what it stands for.” This summer, Bronze received her honorary doctorate from Leeds Beckett University dressed in head-to-toe Aligne. In a perfect example of the brand’s versatility, her mum, aunt and sister were all kitted out in the brand, too.  As Aligne continues to bring confidence-building clothing to the women that want it, the team’s goals include brick-and-mortar stores and more athlete partnerships within the next year. “It’s like my little baby,” says Seymour, “and I just can’t wait to see it grow and shine.” Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Meet The Brand Behind Fashion’s Favorite LoafersHow Tolu Coker Brings Her Culture Into FashionHow Rotate Became Copenhagen’s It Girl Brand
author: Ebony-Renee Baker
